title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 18 ยง 303.5 - Compliance with the Civil Rights Act of 1964 (as amended in 1972) and the Rehabilitation Act of 1973
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 18 ยง 303.5 - Compliance with the Civil Rights Act of 1964 (as amended in 1972) and the Rehabilitation Act of 1973

State Regulations

Applicants for or recipients of public assistance and
care may not be placed in or referred to a public, private nonprofit or private
proprietary facility which discriminates on the basis of race, color, national
origin, age, sex, religion or handicap contrary to the requirements of titles
VI and VII of the Civil Rights Act of 1964, the Rehabilitation Act of 1973, or
violates either section
40
of the Civil

Rights Law of the State of New York or section
296
of the

Executive Law of the State of New York, nor may services be provided which
would be supportive of such facility or vendor payments made
thereto. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 18
ยง
303.5

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
